title: Edwin van der Sar compares Matthijs de Ligt to former team-mate Cristiano Ronaldo
text:
Edwin van der Sar has hailed the mentality of young defender Matthijs de Ligt, as the Ajax chief compared the 20-year-old to Cristiano Ronaldo.

De Ligt enjoyed a fine breakout season for Ajax last campaign, helping guide the Dutch side to the Champions League quarter finals by knocking out Real Madrid and Juventus before losing out to Spurs.

Due to those performances, the Dutchman was at the centre of a transfer war over the summer, with Barcelona, PSG and Juventus vying for the defender's signature.

Matthijs de Ligt's mentality has been compared to that of Juventus star Cristiano Ronaldo

The young defender joined the Old Lady this summer in a mega money deal from Ajax

It was the latter club who eventually won out.

And van der Sar, who has played an integral role in the development of the likes of de Ligt, Frenkie de Jong and Donny van de Beek, has hailed the mentality of de Ligt, before outlining the similarities between the young defender and Cristiano Ronaldo.

'He had been all his life at Ajax. So to step away, move with your girlfriend and the family to a different city, a different language,' said the former Dutch goalkeeper of De Ligt in an interview with ESPN.

'But his mentality and the way he wants to improve… he wants to be the best defender in the world. And I've seen that with a few players. One of them is playing in the same team, Cristiano Ronaldo.

Ajax chief Edwin van der Sar has lauded the strong mentality of the young Dutch player

Van der Sar shared his memories of playing with the Portuguese superstar, before drawing comparisons with de Ligt.

'When I played at Man United with him, he had the same desire and attitude to work hard, to become better every training. And that's the same mentality and hunger as Matthijs de Ligt.'

De Ligt hasn't quite got up and running this season for club and country. The defender was at fault for Nothern Ireland's goal against the Netherlands on Thursday night after being out jumped by Josh Magennis.

The Dutch went on to win 3-1 in their Euro 2020 qualifier.
